How can I change this view?

entry.title: CCM - use of Business Volume and Settlement Material
entry.content:
Dear gurus,

We would like to use business volume and settlement material throughout the rebate process.

Example process:

  1. Condition contract for sales rebates with business volume selection (e.g. on sales org + one sold to), a settlement material and pricing conditions for accrual 3% and rebate 3%.

  2. Accrual build up within billing document by using business volume
    --> 3% accrual condition is applied and posted to FI and CO during posting of billing document, using the sold material master (NOT the settlement material) and the plant.

  3. The accrual percentage in the condition contract is changed from 3% to 5%

  4. A delta accrual (WB2R_UAC) is processed in CCM
    --> Business requirement: post any accrual update to the same granular level in CO as the original billing document (note: this is how VBOF used to work in ECC, as it would generate new FI/CO documents within the billing document).
    --> Solution: Add material number (MATNR) and plant (WERKS) within split criteria of the contract type or process variant.

  5. Partial settlements are processed
    --> Business requirement: post partial settlements on the settlement material (NOT the sales material as in the billing doc.)
    A) Manual partial Settlement (WB2R_DOC_ENTRY)
    --> Solution: user to add manually the settlement material and the amount to be paid to the rebate recipient/customer.
    Q1: Is there any way to automatically take over the settlement material maintained in the condition contract in the manual settlement document?
    B) Automatic partial Settlement (WB2R_SC)
    --> Solution not yet identified
    Q2: Is there a standard configuration to use the settlement material even when business volume is available? Or will this require an enhancement? Currently, when processing automatic partial settlements the system uses the business volume.

  6. Final settlements --> same questions as for partial settlements.

Happy to hear if any of you have had the same requirements and which solution you have found.

Many thanks.

entry.title: We cannot settle the AUC values to GL account after upgrade.
entry.content:
Hi Team,

We have upgraded from 1809 to 2023 version.
 
Case 1: When we are trying to execute AIAB with the following expenditure GL account's 63800180 / 63800190 then we are getting the error ' Receiver categ. KS is not allowed by settlement prof. AI for this sender.' Before the upgrade user was able to execute AIAB using this GL - 63800180 / 63800190. Please help as to how user can use these two accounts for AIAB?
 
Case 2: Now when user is executing AIAB using GL account 23201100 it is successfully saving. But when we execute AIBU for this GL 23201100 for previous year asset to current year then it is giving the error - 'Settlement of Old asset data to receiver type GL Not allowed'. For this also before the upgrade user was able to execute this successfully. How can we avoid this error?
 
We have also replicated this error in QAS system, please find the attached for documentation.

Regards,

Naveen

entry.title: Use of Settlement Material in Settlement Management
entry.content:
Gurus

I am getting error during settlement that No Material Number Passed On.  I do not have a settlement material in my condition contract but I have successfully created settlement documents for other contracts that do not have a settlement material defined.  What other factors could be causing this error to appear?  And where are the controls to determine if a settlement material is required or not?

This is an External Commission scenario.

Thanks for you help.

David

entry.title: Schedule Daily Delta Accruals - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello all, 

We are facing a challenge with "Schedule Contract Settlement - Customer Contracts" app in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. 

We are looking to schedule the Delta Accruals settlement to run recurringly (daily), considering only the period up to the execution date. 

However, we've encountered the following behavior: 

      - The app requires a fixed settlement date.

      - If a broad date range is entered (e.g 01.01 - 31.12), the system processes the entire period at once.

      - There does not appear to be an option to use a dynamic date

We would like to know if there is any official or recommended approach to schedule Delta Accruals with a dynamic settlement date (e.g "today"). 

Thank you in advance for any guidance.

entry.title: REBV condition type showing negative value even after putting positive in condition type control
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

In Condition contract, REBV condition type showing negative value in settlement document even after maintaining positive in condition type controls, because of this, Capped rebated is wrongly  getting calculated as the REBV is base for the calculation. Capped rebate is restricting the maximum value given to the customer per condition contract.

Unflagging returns in item category G2N controls will not help because it will have an issue with other normal order process.

Request to give your inputs on this.

Settlement Management  SAP S/4HANA SAP Pricing and Costing for Utilities

entry.title: Settlement on supplier split criteria tax codes
entry.content:
We use contracts at vendor level - and in the settlement document the vendor's sales should only be split by tax indicator. But if I customize MWSKZ as split criteria, I get two separate item lines in the billing document with the correct sales BUT only with one tax code.

In the WB2R_BUSVOL, however, the sales are split according to tax code

entry.title: Handling Monthly Commission Payments Outside Standard CCM Settlement
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I’d like to share a business case involving Condition Contract Management (CCM) and get your input on how similar scenarios are handled.

Business Case Overview:

  • A fixed monthly commission amount is agreed with a customer.

  • Instead of settling this amount via the condition contract, an incoming invoice is received in the following month, which is then paid.

  • Vendor accruals are created monthly, aligned with the agreed commission.

Key Considerations:

  1. Accrual Creation Timing:
    Accruals are not always created in advance. It’s often during the invoice workflow that it becomes clear the invoice is related to a rebate or commission agreement.
    At that point, it's not always clear whether the invoice should result in an FI or MM posting.

  2. Multiple Vendors for One Accrual:
    There are cases where an accrual is created for one business partner, but invoices are received from multiple vendors, complicating traceability.

  3. Reporting Needs:
    There is a requirement to report per business partner and per material code, showing both:

    • the accrued amounts, and

    • the settled amounts based on posted invoices.

Questions:

  • Has anyone worked with a similar setup where monthly commission payments are processed outside of CCM while creating accurals at the same time? 

  • How can you manage the situation where a rebate agreement is made with a central customer, but multiple different vendors submit invoices related to that rebate?

Thankful for any help or guidance!

Best regards,
Chaima

entry.title: Avoid creation of duplicate condition contract
entry.content:
Dear Expert,

We are using SAP S/4  HANA-2023 on premise. system is allowing to create duplicate condition contract (for same customer, same validity period & same conditions). there is no duplicate entry check if there is an identical condition contract.

Can you please check what configuration is required to avoid creation of duplicate condition contract?

Thank you,

Rahul

entry.title: Change Activation Status of Sales Condition Contract with Released Status
entry.content:
Hello all,

We have approval workflow for sales rebate condition contracts. After release of the condition contract, SAP allows users to make further changes which means that we need to re-trigger the approval workflow because the most recent contract should be approved by authorized user once again. However, since the activation status of the released contract is 'active', the request approval button is disabled and the user first needs to lock the contract then after that, they can only trigger the approval workflow once again. In short, I want to change the activation status of sales condition contract with released status in order to re-trigger the approval workflow once again. Help me figure this issue out either by standard or development in Public Cloud.

Best regards,

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Sales Settlement Management

entry.title: Replacemenet of V_WB2_VBRK_VBRP_1 CDS in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello all,

I need to extract the billing documents that are related to a specific condition contract document in Sales Settlement Management. In an on-premise and private cloud system, we could extract the data from V_WB2_VBRK_VBRP_1 CDS; however, in Public Cloud, I can not find how to retrieve data. I need these billing documents for printing out on the output. Please guide my how can we fetch the relevant data/replacement of V_WB2_VBRK_VBRP_1 CDS in Public Cloud.

Best regards,

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Supply Chain SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Settlement Management

2. Also, After doing manual rebate settlement, in the settlement document flexible overview tab, the actual customer is not getting determined.

How can we achieve above two points. Kindly share your inputs.

Settlement Management SAP S/4HANA Condition contract

entry.title: Growth Rebate in Condition Contract
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We wants to reward our customers that grow their purchase value by more than 15% YoY. Rebates are only applicable if current-year sales exceed base year by a defined percentage.

 For e.g -   Base year: 2024 - Target year: 2025 - Incentive: 5% rebate on incremental sales exceeding 15% growth

Does this scenario us possible in standard CCM S/4 HANA 2023 ? if yes How? 

Thank You

entry.title: Source of data for Settlement Doc Pricing
entry.content:
My scenario is for External Commissions on Billing Docs paid but I think my question is not unique to that scenario.

I want to set RCS1 Commission and RCA1 Accrual condition types in my contract to apply rates based on Customer Price Group and Material Price group from the sales transaction items.  (These are just examples, we could consider any of the sales item fields that we might use in SD pricing.)  I can create the tables and access sequence and assign condition types to groups etc, so I am able to define these conditions in the contract the way i want them.  I have reference doc (Sales Order) and reference item as split criteria in Settlement so each settlement item relates to one sales order item.  However,  when it comes to settlement document pricing, the analysis tells me that no values were found for these fields and so the condition records were not found.   I know these fields are not on settlement item WBRP.  Do they need to be?

First question: is the control to populate the settlement item with data from the business volume in the Split Criteria for settlement?  It seems that these fields only get filled if they are part of the split criteria.

Second question:  Do I need to append the settlement item table to store additional fields for pricing or does pricing read them from the business volume table or CDS view?

If I need to be able to price my settlement items on fields that aren't available on the item, do I append the business volume table, the CDS view, the settlement item or all of these?

Thank you for any guidance you can give.

entry.title: Incorrect scale level picked during final settlement for quantity-based rebate condition
entry.content:
Hello,

In a condition contract using condition type RES1 with Base Scale & condition table 163, we’ve maintained quantity-based scales for two materials: 

Material A: 1 PC = 1%, 5 PC = 2%, 10 PC = 3%

Material B: 20 PC = 2%, 30 PC = 4%, 40 PC = 6%

An invoice contains 7 PC of Material A & 32 PC of Material B. However, during  final settlement, the system incorrectly applies 3% for Material A & 6% for Material B. instead of the expected 2% & 4% resp.

This issue does not occur when only one condition record exists in the contract. Why is the system picking incorrect scale values when multiple condition records are maintained?

Thank you
